pr_title: [TS] Auto tune number of parallel background tasks

timeline.message: Enable autotuning TS pause between iterations
Maintain backwards consistency to fix sensitive tests
Add stress test and some docs
Replace flaky test with nonflaky test

timeline.bodyText: nit: probably just factor out runSweepIterations(iterations) for ticking INITIAL_DELAY + (iterations - 1) * DELAY
timeline.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: In general for tests like this one, you might want to tick the ticker a bit less, check that it hadn't retriggered yet, and then tick it to the required value
timeline.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: We should be able to avoid this: you can pass in a clock or rather Supplier<Instant> to the scheduler
timeline.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: I would throw a SafeIllegalStateException in this case (unless there's some vagary of the type system I'm missing).
timeline.author: jeremyk-91

replies.bodyText: I definitely don't want to throw here, the function has to return Void for the fluent expression above to be happy with typing
replies.author: gmaretic

timeline.bodyText: nit: runningTasks, for consistency with elsewhere in the class.
timeline.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: Let's talk about this tomorrow. I don't see how this change would affect behaviour here, but because of large internal product's lock service implementation, we do need to know if the huge requests were broken.
